name: Hotel Indigo San Diego Gaslamp Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at this very conveniently situated hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, large and quiet. The bathroom was excellent.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.text: Bars and restaurants were within a few minutes walk.
reviews.title: Location, service, style

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very nice surprise

reviews.text: Stylish, well-located, nicely appointed. Super-friendly staff from valet to check-in to restaurant. Terrace upstairs has a nice view and is a great place to grab a drink or take your coffee. Rooms are comfortable, wi-fi is decent, but the wired option is really fast. The shower has one of those wand-type arrangements which jumped out of my hand, turning my morning shower into a Kramer-like adventure. Room has coffee maker, safe and iron, but no refrigerator. Short walk to many bars and restaurants. Valet parking (your only hotel option) is steep at $38. Nice pillows and a shade that makes the room dark made for excellent sleeping. Gym is adequate but not great. Nice view though. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: In San Diego for a conference, and wasn't able to get a hotel adjacent to the Convention Center. Bad news? Absolutely not!! As many have said, location is fantastic...just a few blocks away from 5th St, the baseball field, shopping..whatever you need is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Close to everything, and great customer service

reviews.text: I was here for 3 nights with a day-long business meeting in the conference room. The most memorable part was the incredibly loud noise from construction work being done. It was headache-inducing and it's hard to believe the hotel would even offer to host a meeting during construction.
reviews.title: Ok except for construction noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fine - modern and clean and spacious. Closet was on the small side. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Location is a few blocks away from the touristy Gaslamp area so that's an advantage in that there's less street noise.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay near everything downtown

reviews.text: I would stay here again although last time in San Diego I stayed at the Sofia which was less expensive and more charming if you like older restored hotels. Lots of choices in this area!
reviews.title: Beautiful view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Indigo Hotel and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to PETCO park and 5th Ave in the Gaslamp Qtr (where most of the restaurants, gastro pubs, bars and clubs are located). The rooms are modern, clean and the beds were very comfortable. Reception was professional and efficient checking and out. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay at a reasonable price. The only drawback is the price for parking ($37 a night) which I found steep. I did not ask if there was a discount for multiple night stay as we luckily found a parking spot on the street around the corner from the hotel and did not have to pay. Other than the parking, everything else is great!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely the best view of petco park! Well worth all the one way streets to get there. Within walking distance to park. Nice bar with a terrace view of park. Room service was very prompt and delicious food. Will definitely stay again
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first Yelp review in years. Hotel Indigo San Diego made for one of the greatest nights I have ever experienced.
reviews.title: Above and beyond service on a very important night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our anniversary weekend and I decided I would be proposing to my current girlfriend. I booked a basic room online, and the week of our reservation I decided to call the front desk and see what they could do to help me out with an upgrade. I told them I was proposing and they were extremely helpful finding an affordable upgrade to a basic suite. My plan was to propose on their rooftop deck which overlooks Petco Park.
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To my surprise when I arrived, they UPGRADED US TO THEIR PRESIDENTIAL SUITE, which is right next door to their rooftop deck, with a HUGE patio area, and a better view of Petco Park. I proposed during the fireworks show, she said yes (score!), and it was the greatest night ever. The entire staff knew my secret, it was service above and beyond anything I have experienced at a hotel.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel at a great rate!

reviews.text: Stayed there for a vacation and loved the place. The staff was wonderful and the hotel its self was gorgeous. The room was a little small, but didn't feel cramped or anything. The bed was super comfortable, once it was unburied from all the pillows. The shower was super large, big enough for two (or maybe three...). Plus the room had a tiny Keurig machine.
reviews.title: So fresh and clean, LOVED it.

reviews.text: The restaurant was good and decently priced. It's not a bad place to eat, but with all the choices a few blocks away in the Gas Lamp District, there are plenty of non-hotel food choices around. The ninth floor bar was one of my favorite parts. Though it didn't have the latest hours, it was a very relaxing to sit out on the terrace with a great view of PetCo Field. On the other end of the 9th floor, next to the fitness center there is what they call the "Meditation Terrace"; the view isn't as amazing on that side of the building, but it was always empty. The terrace was a great place to just relax and enjoy the San Diego weather at night.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 9th floor room and even had the convenience of terrace bar and gym on our level! A great new and modern hotel. No fuss check in...actually no fuss in general. Very roomy, with very helpful staff. We had a toilet problem here too but quickly fixed and no problem. Location is an easy walk to Petco Stadium, the Gaslamp Quarter restaurant strip and Horton Plaza. We even walked to the waterfront, though thats mroe difficult to acccess (thank you convention centre!!). Didn't use the hotel restaurant with so much to choose from locally. Would comfortably suit a week-long stay.
reviews.title: A real find!

reviews.text: Fall 2012 NOTE: This hotel is under construction (October 2012 til ?). It is MAJOR construction with heavy metal welding and hammering. I could see the color of the eyes of the workers from my room welding at 8am - very close. I asked for a quiet room when I checked in. I am a Platinum Member at IHG and expect that small requests like this be honored. Another couple checking out at the same time were also upset and complaining (they were on the 5th floor, I was on the 11th and they said the whole building was shaking). IHG needs to disclose, on their web site when you are booking, that there are "special circumstances."
reviews.title: Disappointing: Lack of food options + sleeping difficult

reviews.text: My situation is a bit unique as I need to work nights when I travel for business. I check the hotel web site to make sure that I pick a hotel that is right for me:
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.text: (1) I can sleep soundly until 9am (so I can be awake after 12 hours of work at 11pm); The room doors and shower doors SLAM very loudly. Housekeeping started their repeated (every few minutes), slamming of doors surrounding my room at 8am. I asked them to stop, please, and they looked miffed (I was interrupting their work/cleaning deadline, I guess?). So sorry. Also, searing sunlight from under curtains that do not touch the floor in AM (East side).
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: (2) I can eat dinner - even a light dinner - after 10pm. Well, the Hotel Indigo's web site says they have '24-hour room service' but it is more like 24-hour snack service. You can find better food (muffins, pre-made sandwich, cookie) at a 7-Eleven. The bar closes early if it is slow. Food stops at 10pm. I travel alone and don't want to go out looking for food at 11pm. Just tell me on the web site that you do not have meals after 10pm. Next time I can choose somewhere else. Thanks.
reviews.title: Pure bliss!

description: Welcome to the Hotel Indigo! From the moment you enter, you will be invited with the soothing sounds of the floor to ceiling water wall and captivated by locally photographed wall murals. Our refreshingly local Hotel Indigo staff is here to show you just what makes San Diego ‘America’s Finest City.’ Before heading out, we invite you to enjoy an evening cocktail on our Level 9 Rooftop Bar. Sit by the fire pit or reflective pool and enjoy breathtaking views of downtown San Diego and PETCO Park. Unwind with colleagues or meet new friends before exploring all the Gaslamp Quarter has to offer! Prepare for a calming nights sleep with the textures and warm earth-tones that make you forget that you are in a hotel. The iHome allows you to awaken with your favorite music while you refresh in the glass enclosed spa shower.You are invited to sit streetside in our open air Table 509 Bar and Kitchen and feel the energy and vibrance of downtown San Diego while enjoying a fresh cup of locally brewed Café Moto coffee.
